H0.text: Meninges are the protective covering of the brain and spinal cord in the central nervous system.

H1.text: Neutrophils protect the brain and spinal cord in the central nervous system.

H2.text: Dermis is the protective layer that safeguards the brain and spinal cord in the central nervous system.

H3.text: Flexing protects the brain and spinal cord in the central nervous system.

A4.text: The meninges act as a physical and immunological protective barrier for the brain and spinal cord, shielding the central nervous system (CNS) from injury.

A5.text: They anchor and support the tissues of the CNS, and provide containment for cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and the arteries and veins that supply blood to the brain and spinal cord.
